comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=18815386 for some biographical details.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content:
The writing at the top says something like: 
Gold bead gown.  Emb'd in gold.  Headband gold circled with pearls.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: broadwayworld.com/bwidb/productions/Lombardi,_Ltd._316245/ indicates that she and Warner Baxter were both in the cast of Lombardi, Ltd.at the Morosco Theater (Broadway, New York, NY) which opened on September 24, 1917 and ran for 296 performances. hollywoodheyday.blogspot.com/2010/06/whos-who-this-week-i... indicates that they were married on the opening day of the show, i.e., in 1917. But the Wikipedia article for Baxter has them marrying in 1918. Another disagreement is over her place of birth. Whereas she is most often described as a Los Angeles native, www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=18815386 says she was born in Columbus, Ohio and headed to Los Angeles in 1915. Her obituary in the LA Times says she was born in Los Angeles. articles.latimes.com/1987-08-23/news/mn-3076_1_winifred-b...

comment.author: 8777005@N06
comment._content: Hello, Winifred Bryson was born in Los Angeles. She was my grandfather's cousin. The spelling of her name was Brison, changed to Bryson at some point. She and Warner raised her niece, Betty Bryson, who was born Elizabeth Meiklejohn. I wish I had more information for you!

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: swanq: and denifoster:  Thank you for giving us more details about the life of Winifred Bryson.  We will add some of it to the image description when we update.
